intro: Otholobium wilmsii, commonly known as the Wilmsii burr bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces spherical, woody pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Otholobium wilmsii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
